
{{alias}}( arr1, arr2, ...[, options] )
    Returns an array of arrays where the ith element (tuple) in each returned
    array contains the ith elements of the input arrays.

    Parameters
    ----------
    arr1: ArrayLike
        First input array.

    arr2: ArrayLike
        Second input array.

    ...: ArrayLike
        Additional input arrays.

    options: Object (optional)
        Options.

    options.trunc: boolean (optional)
        Boolean specifying whether the returned array should truncate arrays
        longer than the shortest array. Default: true.

    options.fill: any (optional)
        Fill value used for arrays of unequal length. Default: null.

    options.arrays: boolean (optional)
        Boolean specifying whether the function should interpret a single input
        array as an array of arrays to be zipped. Default: false.

    Returns
    -------
    out: Array
        Array of arrays.

    Examples
    --------
    > var zipped = {{alias}}( [ 1, 2 ], [ 'a', 'b' ] )
    [ [ 1, 'a' ], [ 2, 'b' ] ]

    // Function behavior:
    > var opts = { 'trunc': false };
    > zipped = {{alias}}( [ 1, 2, 3 ], [ 'a', 'b' ], opts );
    [ [ 1, 'a' ], [ 2, 'b' ], [ 3, null ] ]

    // Array of arrays:
    > opts = { 'arrays': true };
    > zipped = {{alias}}( [ 1, 2, 3 ], [ 'a', 'b' ], opts );
    [ [ 1, 'a' ], [ 2, 'b' ], [ 3, null ] ]
